Tucson could hardly wait to go inside to see what was happening. =C2=A0But =
he knew he couldn't get past the guards at the mouth of the cave. All he co=
uld do, is keep his head up, and cock his head to one side, hoping to hear =
what was going on in the cave. =C2=A0He was going to be a father shortly, a=
nd the anticipation of that was happy yet anxious at the same time. =C2=A0H=
e was behaving himself nicely though, and that made quite an impression on =
an old female who now sits beside him. =C2=A0She would be the one to determ=
ine when it was time to enter the cave. =C2=A0=C2=A0

" Oh, I see. =C2=A0On=
ly when the child is born, can I enter the cave. =C2=A0I do respect that in=
definitely. =C2=A0Although I worry for her condition, and what if there are=
 complications during the birth? =C2=A0I keep forgetting, you do not unders=
tand my modern language."

He reverts to using the low rumbles that a drago=
n would use, while communicating with others. =C2=A0She understands him and=
 converses with him. =C2=A0She reassures him that everything will be fine, =
and that Nature has already begun to take its course. =C2=A0She rests her c=
hin on his left front haunch, for reassurance. =C2=A0He intern bows his hea=
d to her in respect. =C2=A0 After all, she was a mother herself, and had pr=
oduced many offspring in her lifetime. =C2=A0Most of the females that were =
inside the cave now, were her children, save for two or three males, who we=
re now watching over the rookery or hunting for food to bring back for the =
clan. =C2=A0Tucson would miss all of this, becoming one with Nature, and in=
teracting with the creatures that lived on Old Earth. =C2=A0There was love =
here, and unity, and a harmony that could never be replaced on his home wor=
ld of Cybertron. =C2=A0

Inside the cave, the females continue to watch Tal=
on carefully, yet still give her personal space, while they watch her push =
during labor. =C2=A0During the process, the females tend to the large soft =
bed and reinforce it with more material to continue to keep it soft and com=
fortable. =C2=A0A fire is stoked a good distance away from the nest. =C2=A0=
This would prove good warmpth and keep the cave at an even temperature to p=
revent hypothermia to both parent and offspring. =C2=A0The dragons were org=
anized and knew exactly what to do during the birth of a child. =C2=A0This =
also would put Tucson's mind at ease, as he heaves a sigh, and lies down be=
side the old female.
=C2=A0
Respect those as you wish to be respected.

icipation of that was happy yet anxious at the same time.  He was beha=
ving himself nicely though, and that made quite an impression on an old fem=

nbsp;I keep forgetting, you do not understand my modern language."</span></=

ern bows his head to her in respect.   After all, she was a mother her=

males that were inside the cave now, were her children, save for two or thr=
ee males, who were now watching over the rookery or hunting for food to bri=
ng back for the clan.  Tucson would miss all of this, becoming one wit=
h Nature, and interacting with the creatures that lived on Old Earth. &nbsp=
;There was love here, and unity, and a harmony that could
 never be replace=
d on his home world of Cybertron.  </span></div><div><span><br></span>=

ve good warmpth and keep the cave at an even temperature to prevent hypothe=
rmia to both parent and offspring.  The dragons were organized and kne=
w exactly what to do during the birth of a child.  This also would put=
 Tucson's mind at ease, as he heaves a sigh, and lies down beside the old f=
emale.</div><div> </div><div>Respect those as you wish to be respected=
